In the narrow meaning that we apply to cryptography, consensus is a voting procedure. Its goal is to ensure that all members of the network agree on its current state even after the addition of a new block or a package of transactions. In other words, a consensus protocol guarantees that the chain is true and that there are incentives to keep participants fair. Itâ€™s a major framework for preventing a single entity from controlling the entire system and makes sure everybody follows the rules.
